conclusion: Analyze the motion of the basketball under gravity and air resistance before and after collision.
Analyze the descent phase of the basketball.
Net force during descent is mg(1 - λ).
Acceleration during descent is g(1 - λ).
Velocity just before hitting the ground is v0 = √(2g(1 - λ)H).
Analyze the ascent phase of the basketball.
Net force during ascent is -mg(1 + λ).
Velocity just after leaving the ground is v1 = √(2g(1 + λ)h).
Ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is √((1 + λ)h / (1 - λ)H).
Final ratio of velocities is √((1 + λ)h / (1 - λ)H).
